column4: I just ran an update using the terminal, did the restart, and when it rebooted it got stuck on the screen with the progress bar and ubuntu logo. I've manually turned it off and retried it several times but I get nothing. Does anybody know whot to fix this?
you upgraded to 8.10 or higher? from below that?
ubuntu runs that graphic stuff on top of X, compiz or somewhat
When I was updating, I accidentally closed my laptop, and the internet stopped.
I need to totally reinstall ubuntu?
I was just doing a partial update. I wasn't switching versions.
ok, do u use compiz religiously?
I don't really know what compiz is. So.. I doubt it.
since you didn't know Ubuntu probably is but didn't tell you
hm i forgot how to turn off compiz without using the gui
the problem is, I can't boot up my system.
can you boot into single user mode from start up? or does it get that far after POST?
I can get to the GRUB Screen, then I can select the usual four options, but after that, nothing boots.
Mmk. A clean install will probably fix the problem. I appreciate the help though. :)
